D:/Programming/Projects/depot/SekaiFramework/src/reflection/delegate/Delegate_deleg.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // Once we have the member function conversion templates, it's easy to make the
00002 // wrapper classes. So that they will work with as many compilers as possible, 
00003 // the classes are of the form
00004 //   Delegate3<int, char *, double>
00005 // They can cope with any combination of parameters. The max number of parameters
00006 // allowed is 8, but it is trivial to increase this limit.
00007 // Note that we need to treat const member functions seperately.
00008 // All this class does is to enforce type safety, and invoke the delegate with
00009 // the correct list of parameters.
00010 
00011 // Because of the weird rule about the class of derived member function pointers,
00012 // you sometimes need to apply a downcast to the 'this' pointer.
00013 // This is the reason for the use of "implicit_cast<X*>(pthis)" in the code below. 
00014 // If CDerivedClass is derived from CBaseClass, but doesn't override SimpleVirtualFunction,
00015 // without this trick you'd need to write:
00016 //              MyDelegate(static_cast<CBaseClass *>(&d), &CDerivedClass::SimpleVirtualFunction);
00017 // but with the trick you can write
00018 //              MyDelegate(&d, &CDerivedClass::SimpleVirtualFunction);
00019 
00020 // RetType is the type the compiler uses in compiling the template. For VC6,
00021 // it cannot be void. DesiredRetType is the real type which is returned from
00022 // all of the functions. It can be void.
00023 
00024 // Implicit conversion to "bool" is achieved using the safe_bool idiom,
00025 // using member data pointers (MDP). This allows "if (dg)..." syntax
00026 // Because some compilers (eg codeplay) don't have a unique value for a zero
00027 // MDP, an extra padding member is added to the SafeBool struct.
00028 // Some compilers (eg VC6) won't implicitly convert from 0 to an MDP, so
00029 // in that case the static function constructor is not made explicit; this
00030 // allows "if (dg==0) ..." to compile.
00031 
00033 
00034 namespace detail
00035 {
00036         template<class RetType>
00037         struct deleg_traits0
00038         {
00039                 typedef typename detail::DefaultVoidToVoid<RetType>::type DesiredRetType;
00040                 typedef DesiredRetType (*StaticFunctionPtr)();
00041                 typedef RetType (*UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr)();
00042                 typedef RetType (detail::GenericClass::*GenericMemFn)();
00043                 typedef detail::ClosurePtr<GenericMemFn, StaticFunctionPtr, UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr> ClosureType;
00044         };
00045 
00046         template<class Param1, class RetType>
00047         struct deleg_traits1
00048         {
00049                 typedef typename detail::DefaultVoidToVoid<RetType>::type DesiredRetType;
00050                 typedef DesiredRetType (*StaticFunctionPtr)(Param1 p1);
00051                 typedef RetType (*UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr)(Param1 p1);
00052                 typedef RetType (detail::GenericClass::*GenericMemFn)(Param1 p1);
00053                 typedef detail::ClosurePtr<GenericMemFn, StaticFunctionPtr, UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr> ClosureType;
00054         };
00055

00062                 typedef RetType (detail::GenericClass::*GenericMemFn)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2);

00122                 typedef RetType (detail::GenericClass::*GenericMemFn)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2, Param3 p3, Param4 p4, Param5 p5, Param6 p6, Param7 p7, Param8 p8);

00128 
00129         template<class Traits>
00130         class DelegateN
00131         {
00132         protected:
00133                 typedef DelegateN<Traits> base;
00134                 typedef Traits traits;
00135                 typedef typename traits::DesiredRetType DesiredRetType;
00136                 typedef typename traits::StaticFunctionPtr StaticFunctionPtr;
00137                 typedef typename traits::UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr UnvoidStaticFunctionPtr;
00138                 typedef typename traits::GenericMemFn GenericMemFn;
00139                 typedef typename traits::ClosureType ClosureType;
00140                 ClosureType m_Closure;
00141 
00142                 DelegateN() { clear(); }
00143                 DelegateN(const DelegateN &x) { m_Closure.CopyFrom(this, x.m_Closure); }
00144                 void operator =(const DelegateN &x)  { m_Closure.CopyFrom(this, x.m_Closure); }
00145                 bool operator ==(const DelegateN &x) const { return m_Closure.IsEqual(x.m_Closure);     }
00146                 bool operator !=(const DelegateN &x) const { return !m_Closure.IsEqual(x.m_Closure); }
00147                 bool operator <(const DelegateN &x) const { return m_Closure.IsLess(x.m_Closure);       }
00148                 bool operator >(const DelegateN &x) const { return x.m_Closure.IsLess(m_Closure);       }
00149 
00150         private:
00151                 // Implicit conversion to "bool" using the safe_bool idiom
00152                 typedef struct SafeBoolStruct 
00153                 {
00154                         int a_data_pointer_to_this_is_0_on_buggy_compilers;
00155                         StaticFunctionPtr m_nonzero;
00156                 } UselessTypedef;
00157                 typedef StaticFunctionPtr SafeBoolStruct::*unspecified_bool_type;
00158         public:
00159                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const { return empty()? 0: &SafeBoolStruct::m_nonzero; }
00160                 // necessary to allow ==0 to work despite the safe_bool idiom
00161                 inline bool operator==(StaticFunctionPtr funcptr) { return m_Closure.IsEqualToStaticFuncPtr(funcptr); }
00162                 inline bool operator!=(StaticFunctionPtr funcptr) { return !m_Closure.IsEqualToStaticFuncPtr(funcptr); }
00163                 inline bool operator !() const  { return !m_Closure; }
00164                 inline bool empty() const { return !m_Closure; }
00165                 void clear() { m_Closure.clear();}
00166                 // Conversion to and from the FunctionData storage class
00167                 const FunctionData & GetFunctionData() { return m_Closure; }
00168                 void SetFunctionData(const FunctionData &any) { m_Closure.CopyFrom(this, any); }
00169         };
00170 }

00174 //N=0
00175 template<class RetType=detail::DefaultVoid>
00176 class Delegate0 : public detail::DelegateN< detail::deleg_traits0<RetType> > 
00177 {
00178 public:
00179         // Typedefs to aid generic programming
00180         typedef Delegate0 type;
00181 
00182         // Construction and comparison functions
00183         Delegate0() { }
00184         Delegate0(const Delegate0 &x) : base(x) { }
00185         void operator = (const Delegate0 &x) { base::operator=(x); }
00186         // Binding to non-const member functions
00187         template < class X, class Y >
00188         Delegate0(Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)() ) {
00189                 m_Closure.bindmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<X*>(pthis), function_to_bind); }
00190         template < class X, class Y >
00191         inline void bind(Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)()) {
00192                 m_Closure.bindmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<X*>(pthis), function_to_bind);      }
00193         // Binding to const member functions.
00194         template < class X, class Y >
00195         Delegate0(const Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)() const) {
00196                 m_Closure.bindconstmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<const X*>(pthis), function_to_bind);   }
00197         template < class X, class Y >
00198         inline void bind(const Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)() const) {
00199                 m_Closure.bindconstmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<const X *>(pthis), function_to_bind);  }
00200         // Static functions. We convert them into a member function call.
00201         // This constructor also provides implicit conversion
00202         Delegate0(DesiredRetType (*function_to_bind)() ) {
00203                 bind(function_to_bind); }
00204         // for efficiency, prevent creation of a temporary
00205         void operator = (DesiredRetType (*function_to_bind)() ) {
00206                 bind(function_to_bind); }
00207         inline void bind(DesiredRetType (*function_to_bind)()) {
00208                 m_Closure.bindstaticfunc(this, &Delegate0::InvokeStaticFunction, 
00209                         function_to_bind); }
00210         // Invoke the delegate
00211         RetType operator() () const { return (m_Closure.GetThisPtr()->*(m_Closure.GetClosureMemPtr()))(); }
00212 
00213 private:        // Invoker for static functions
00214         RetType InvokeStaticFunction() const {
00215                 return (*(m_Closure.GetStaticFunction()))(); }
00216 };

00365 template<class Param1, class Param2, class Param3, class Param4, class Param5, class RetType=detail::DefaultVoid>
00366 class Delegate5 : public detail::DelegateN< detail::deleg_traits5<Param1, Param2, Param3, Param4, Param5, RetType> >
00367 {
00368 public:
00369         typedef Delegate5 type;
00370 
00371         Delegate5() { }
00372         Delegate5(const Delegate5 &x) : base(x) { }
00373         void operator = (const Delegate5 &x)  { base::operator=(x); }
00374         template < class X, class Y >
00375         Delegate5(Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2, Param3 p3, Param4 p4, Param5 p5) ) {
00376                 m_Closure.bindmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<X*>(pthis), function_to_bind); }
00377         template < class X, class Y >
00378         inline void bind(Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2, Param3 p3, Param4 p4, Param5 p5)) {
00379                 m_Closure.bindmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<X*>(pthis), function_to_bind);      }
00380         template < class X, class Y >
00381         Delegate5(const Y *pthis, DesiredRetType (X::* function_to_bind)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2, Param3 p3, Param4 p4, Param5 p5) const) {
00382                 m_Closure.bindconstmemfunc(detail::implicit_cast<const X*>(pthis), function_to_bind);   }
